author: potuz
content: <@!291925846556540928> perhaps you could add a link to crypto-devs in the message in <#745072678079168654>? so that we can quickly just point people asking for coding support to go there and grab the invite?

author: potuz
content: Like right after `There are abundant resources online to get you up to speed on Ethereum...`  add an `eg. blah`.

author: potuz
content:
I know nothing about this topic, but I've seen lots of people pointing to crypto-devs. So what I do is I point to this message in the apprenticeship program that contains a couple of links and a discord invite:
https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/595701895700676644/869799415852969984

author: potuz
content: so my `blah`  would be `eg. Crytpo devs discord <invite here>  or the Open Zeppeling learn guides <link here>`  but I am not sure if you would want it to look like the EF is actually vouching for these places

author: chris2_2_2
content: have there been any tests as to the max block size (gas) that the ethereum mainnet can handle?

author: pipermerriam
content: Going forward, use of the R&D discord server to solicit individual support for things that aren't related to "protocol development" efforts is going to tend to result in being kicked (not banned) from the server and your message deleted.  There has been a significant rise in this type of message from new people joining this server and the overhead dealing with moderation related to this stuff has gone up with it.

author: pietjepuk
content: Could you (or Danny) add some links in the <#745072678079168654> channel? For example https://ethereum.org/en/learn/  and https://ethereum.org/en/community/ should get many people started I think

author: pietjepuk
content: On that note, the Ethereum.org team should probably add "not for general help questions" next to the Eth R&D Discord link.

author: pipermerriam
content:
<@!485238712415027221> ^^  is this something you could update/adjust to make it a bit clearer.  Maybe moving the R&D discord link further down in that list and adding something that is maybe a little "loud" that states these two things clearly:

1. Not for individual support or assistance.
2. Strictly for focused discussions around core protocol development.

Seems like CryptoDev discord should be higher up in the list.

author: pipermerriam
content: <@!397389662085185547> thanks for pointing this out.  I wasn't aware of that list.
